  • *Responsibilities**
The sponsors requires a Data Scientist with experience in cyber risk and security.The person selected for this position shall have practical hands-on, as well as enterprise/policy level experience.This role includes applying established or developing new programmatic and quantitative methods to find patterns and relationships in large data sets; conducting mathematical, statistical, geospatial modeling, or otherdata-driven problem-solving analysis to address business operations questions; identifying and collaborating with collectors and analysts to determine the data needed to address problems, and incorporating insights and findings into a broad range of products.These products can range from those that provide direct mission support to those that provide capabilities to peers and colleagues. The work includes the design, modification, and/or use of scientific computing, programming, and mathematics.Specific responsibilities include,but are not limited to the following:

+ Collaborating with Cybersecurity SMEs to develop practical analytic cyber security behavioral models to identify, qualify, prioritize, and proactively manage cyber risks, e.g.anomalous behaviors across an **IT** enterprise

+ Applying rigor in qualifying the cyber risk in terms that can be used to prioritize cyber risk mitigation approaches

+ Developing warning triggers/conditions that indicate an unacceptable level of cyber risk

+ Assisting with the development and institution of a cyber-risk continuous validation and compliance system

+ Identifying and networking with appropriate internal and external sources to gather and/or exchange data on specialized matters.

+ Engaging with customers to determine the nature of analytic problems, evaluate options, and offer recommendations for resolution.

+ Building and exploit database and files

+ Advising customers on the methods and data needed and/or available to evaluation the problems.

+ Collaborating with collectors and analysts to identify and close gaps on complex problems; devising creative data collection and analysis strategies.

+ Conceiving, preparing, and communicate a wide range of strategic, highly complex graphics, computational models/tools, or written/oral assessments to internal and external customers.

+ Conceive and prepare thorough, well-argued and authoritative tactical and strategic analytic products (e., technical articles, graphic depictions, intelligence reports) summarizing the methods and results of data analysis

+ Acquiring, processing, and refining large or complex data sets from various sources, utilizing computer programming where necessary

+ Analyzing, evaluating, and assessing quantitative data (using statistical software, computer models, geospatial models, software languages, and mathematical models) to contribute to or develop software tools, analytic models, or reports.

+ Conducting statistical, mathematical, geospatial modeling or data-mining analysis in partnership with other Data scientist(s) or Analyst colleagues.

+ Anticipate and project a wide range of possible outcomes using scenario/alternative analysis,machine learning, and agent based modeling or other advance analytictechniques.

Identify, use,and/or develop a wide range of methodologies and analytic toolsto address existing or potential intelligence problems and collection strategies
  • *Qualifications**
+ Knowledge and experience working withstatistical tools such as,SAS,R,SPSS, Matlab,Mahour/MADlib,Stata,

+ Experience work with programming languages,such as SQL,C/C++, Java,Python,Perl

+ Experience working with data management tools,such as Hadoop,MapReduce,Pig, Hive,NoSQL, Tableau, Hbase

+ Working knowledge of appropriate analytic method and methodologicaltoolsin one ormore fo the following areas:

+ Applied mathematics (e.g.,probability and statistics,formal modeling,computational social sciences)

+ Computer programming (e.g., programming languages, math/statistics packages,computer science, machinelearning,scientific computing)

+ Visualization (e.g.,GIS/geospatialanalysis,telemetry analysis)

+ Working knowledge of research design

+ Working knowledge of collection methods,capabilities,andtasking process

+ Familiarity with project management concepts and principles

+ Ability to leverage multiple data management tools to organizerelevantinformation and make

+ decisions

+ Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in engineering, IT,or computer science

+ Minimum of 12 years'experience,plus 3+ years supporting the Sponsor

+ Excellent oral and writtencommunications skills
